1.brief: David, the youngest son of Jesse
physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music

2.brief: to depress, i.e. prostrate (especially reflexive, in homage to royalty or God)
near, with or among; often in general, to
a large public building, such as a palace or temple
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

to be (causatively make) large (in various senses, as in body, mind, estate or honor, also in pride)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

3.brief: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
to urge severely, i.e. (figuratively) importune, embolden, capture, act insolently
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)

4.brief: physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to

5.brief: a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

6.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
remoteness, i.e. (concretely) a distant place; often (adverbially) from afar

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

7.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:
to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south

8.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to end (in the sense of completion or failure)
in up to or over against; generally at, beside, among, behind, for, etc.
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to slacken (in many applications, literal or figurative)
